intro: Galium album var. praticola, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance.
